scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
SAML 2.0 is included in the Slovakian national catalogue of recommended specifications. The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of Slovakia is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets

See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement: The purpose of SAML 2.0 is not related to the publication of data as Open Data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

statement:

All the information related to a TC activity is hosted and can be consulted. 
See: 
https://www.oasis-open.org/policies-guidelines/tc-process-2017-05-26

criterion_description: The standard or specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
The OASIS Security Services Technical Committee, in charge of the development of SAML 2.0, operates under RF on RAND Mode of the OASIS IPR Policy. The specification is licensed on a Royalty-free and (F)RAND basis.

See:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/security/ipr.php

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is sufficiently mature and has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement: The specification was carried out in 2001 and has been developed and maintained by OASIS. It has suffered 1 minor update (SAML 1.1) and a major one (SAML 2.0). This fact demonstrates the maturity of the specification that is being assessed. Moreover, it is also implemented by IT vendors and suppliers having a market dominance. For instance, SAML 2.0 is implemented by Microsoft for the Microsoft Azure Active Directory and by Amazon for Amazon Web Services. Therefore, it is demonstrated that SAML 2.0 has enough maturity and market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement: At the moment of performing the assessment, SAML 2.0 is widely used to secure and authenticate access to the internal and external platforms as eases the single sign-on (SSO). These types of resources are included in the development of platforms and services, including innovative solutions.

statement:
OASIS is a non-profit consortium that drives the development, convergence and adoption of open standards for the global information society, SAML 2.0 is developed and maintained by OASIS consortium. 

See:
https://www.oasis-open.org/org

criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the visibility and comprehensibility of administrative rules, processes, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement: By allowing the authentication for using services SAML 2.0 fosters visibility by simplifying access to administrationsâ services. Moreover, it can be used internally by public officers which enhances the decision-making process.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification helps ensuring the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement: The purpose of SAML 2.0 is not related to the availability of interfaces. The specifications aim to authenticate and authorise access to resources or services.

criterion_description: The standard or specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.Â
statement: SAML 2.0 is a business domain agnostic specification.

statement:
SAML 2.0 is available for its study and use at OASISâs webpage. Therefore it can be reused by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.

See:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/security/saml/Post2.0/sstc-saml-tech-overview-2.0.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is independent from any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
SAML 2.0 can be used independently from any other technical specifications or operating system. The specification has been developed by OASIS Security Services Technical Committee independently from any specific platforms or technologies. Even though SAML 2.0 is XML based specifications, as XML is a well-known specification it does not cause technological dependency. 

See:
https://developers.onelogin.com/saml
http://docs.oasis-open.org/security/saml/Post2.0/sstc-saml-tech-overview-2.0.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
By using SAML 2.0, the system administrator is prevented from providing several authentication tokens and, the user does not have to deal with several credentials. This fact helps to adapt the specification to userâs needs without hampering the scalability of systems. 

In addition, SAML 2.0 allows the exchange of authentication and authorization data between parties. It is mainly used to ensure single sign-on (SSO).  It extends SSO across security domains independently from any platform which prevents non-interoperable proprietary technologies.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
SAML 2.0 is a format that allows seamless cross-border interoperability between systems, independent of implementation. 

The specification allows cross-domain single sign-on, which reduces the administrative burden of the system administrators and the users. As well, providing authentication across sectors and platforms allows administrations and stakeholders to exchange and reuse data fostering the data portability across borders.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
The application of the once-only principle in all EU Member States public administrations aims at reducing the administrative burden. To achieve this, interoperability between public administrations is a sine qua non condition.

SAML 2.0 is a format that allows seamless cross-border interoperability between systems, independent of implementation. 

The specification allows cross-domain single sign-on, which reduces the administrative burden of the system administrators and the users. By using SAML 2.0, avoid the user to deal with several credentials nor provide information twice.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement: The purpose of SAML 2.0 is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement: The specification allows the exchange of authentication and authorization data between parties. It is mainly used to ensure single sign-on (SSO).  It extends SSO across security domains independently from any platform which prevents non-interoperable proprietary technologies. For instance, a relevant implementation of SAML 2.0 is SAML Web Browser SSO profile. This profile was specified to promote interoperability by allowing the authentication to service providers through external identity providers.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement: The purpose of SAML 2.0 is not related to the delivery of multilingual public services. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The adoption of the standard or specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
The specification allows cross-domain single sign-on, which reduces the administrative burden of the system administrators and the users. By using SAML 2.0, the system administrator is prevented from providing several authentication tokens and, the user does not have to deal with several credentials. 
In addition, the use of the specifications helps to enhance and foster digital communication between administrations and users avoiding the non-digital data exchange.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement: The purpose of SAML 2.0 is not related to the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the standard or specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are several existing documents and studies assessing SAML 2.0 features and capabilities and efficiency. Broadly speaking, the studies are focused on the capability to enable Single Sign-on and its benefits. 
See:
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/221609828_Formal_analysis_of_SAML_20_web_browser_single_sign-on
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/45872317_Web_single_sign-on_authentication_using_SAML

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification can be mapped to the EIRA.
statement:
SAML 2.0 is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). Specifically, SAML 2.0 can define the interoperability aspects of the "Identity management Component", âIdentity Management Serviceâ, âAccess Management Componentâ, and âAccess Management Serviceâ ABBs of the EIRA Technical View.
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/distribution/eliscataloguev100betaxlsx

criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the standard or specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
There are existing mechanisms to carry out SAML 2.0 conformity. For instance, SAMLtool.com provides a SAML Response XML validation on open source that can be found at their Github. 

See:
https://www.samltool.com/validate_response.php
https://www.samltool.com/

statement:
2 Member States are recommending SAML 2.0 in their ICT National Catalogues. 
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been selected for its use in a EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
SAML 2.0 is a format that allows seamless cross-border interoperability between systems, independently of existing implementations.

To demonstrate this fact is worth to take into account that in the context of Connecting Europe Facility (CEF), the CEF eID Building Block has been developed to support the (eiDAS) regulation. This building block includes technical specifications composing the âeiDAS eiD profileâ.  Among these specifications, the eiDAS SAML Attribute Profile defines the SAML 2.0 attributes to be used for the assertion of natural and legal person identity between eIDAS nodes. 

See: 
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A32013R1316
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A32015R1501https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eID 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/sites/default/files/document/2015-11/eidas_interoperability_architecture_v1.00.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
The specification is included in 2 Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications. Examples of Member States including SAML 2.0 on their catalogues are Portugal and Slovakia.
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement: SAML 2.0 is not included in any catalogue of standards at supra-national level.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
The use of SAML 2.0 has been agreed for the eiDAS technical subgroup to use the specification on the eiD Building Block to support eiDAS regulation. The regulation 910/2014 is a document that implies all the Member States and their responsibilities as public services providers. Therefore, the agreement for using SAML 2.0 as part of the eiD Building to support eiDAS regulation can be understood as an agreement involving public services providers. 

See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/futurium/en/content/eidas-regulation-regulation-eu-ndeg9102014

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
SAML 2.0 has been assessed by CAMSS Team in the context of MSP scenario, which is fully compliant with the Standardisation Regulation 1025/2012.
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/camss-assessment-saml-20-msp-scenario

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling standard or specification.
statement: The purpose of SAML 2.0 is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

criterion_description: The standard or specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement: The purpose of SAML 2.0 is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement: SAML 2.0 is not defining a cross-sector reusable data model. The specification defines a schema for the assertions that are involved in SAML performance but it cannot be considered as a data model.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement: The purpose of SAML 2.0 is not related to the publication of data as Linked Open Data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

criterion_description: The standard or specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
SAML 2.0 is not available at any European or National platform for its use and implementation. Despite this, the specification is available at OASISâs webpage.
